audio_caption: The clip begins with upbeat, electronic music with a dance-like tempo, evoking a celebratory and energetic mood. Then, speech starts with a male voice expressing that something may have been too fast for the camera. A second male voice agrees, and the first male voice suggests checking. The second voice also agrees. A third male voice announces they will get a "clap." Following that, a loud clap sound effect is heard. The second voice claims the clap was good. A fourth male voice concurs. Someone says it's "the best clap of the show". Finally, a male voice states, "My name is Jimmy".

The audio clip begins with an introduction, a male voice announcing "his name is Jake, and this is The Weekly Dumb." Jake then introduces himself, including his full name and a bit about his birthday and weekend, mentioning getting his second vaccine shot. Another voice chimes in, stating "I kissed Jake, so now I am fully vaccinated as well", adding that Jake is "fully hydrated." Jake's voice returns, affirming the need to "stay hydrated." Sounds of movement are heard, followed by liquids being shaken and poured out, before the first male speaker utters "Wow." The audio then ends with the second speaker adding, "You can have some," followed by "Wow."

The clip begins with a single male speaker inquiring about sports. Another male speaker excitedly describes a big sports weekend, including the NFL draft, baseball, and the Kentucky Derby. He mentions a horse named Medina Spirit that won over the weekend, purchased for $1,000. He suggests that the listener is now an instant fan. The first speaker excitedly agrees, stating he can't wait for the movie.

The clip starts with one male speaker expressing his love for boxing and horse racing movies, followed by his less enthusiastic feelings about boxing and horse racing in real life. He then declares "Seabiscuit's the best movie ever made", praising it as his "number one ever". The speaker then reveals he likes watching it at night to relax, which is humorously dismissed by a second male speaker as a "noise machine". The first speaker defends the movie by mentioning great quotes, but the second speaker retorts that noise machines can be good, too, prompting the first speaker to say noise machines can be terrible, followed by an awful sound. The second speaker remarks that he hates noise machines. The first speaker then refers to the second speaker as a "human noise machine", which the second speaker rejects. After that, the second speaker makes a sound effect, followed by an acknowledgment from the first. Lastly, the first speaker transitions to a new topic, introducing one of the second speaker's favorites.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating they need to "break down this Britney Spears sandwich" in a conversational tone. The speaker is followed by another male, who responds with uncertainty, saying "I don't know man, I don't know." Both speakers seem to be engaged in a casual dialogue.

The clip starts with a man talking about recreating a favorite sandwich from a New York deli, but making "the least New York sandwich" he's ever seen, listing off ingredients like goat cheese ("not a sandwich cheese"), walnuts (identified as almonds), shredded chicken and turkey. Another man responds with hot takes, saying he likes the final result, continuing to mention avocado and pears (described as "they look like fish, but it's not"), then mentioning lettuce. The first man then declares that the sandwich is basically a salad with bread around it. The second man agrees "some sandwiches do that, you're right"

The audio clip features two male speakers discussing food, particularly a sandwich that falls apart due to a lack of structure. One speaker describes his lunch experience, saying it was "pretty good, but I still need lunch," while the other speaker jokes about Britney, calling the sandwich "the meanest sandwich known to mankind." A transition follows, featuring a distinct "wah-wah" sound effect before one of the speakers begins discussing the sports world.

The clip starts with two speakers, both male. One is excited, talking about the Diamondbacks and mentioning "Jake Snakes" and "D-back it up," before changing the subject to an e-sports star. The other chimes in with "mhm." The first speaker goes on to describe a social media stunt that the Diamondbacks pulled, mentioning they found a guy on a date. A brief bit of music with an electronic sound effect plays. The first speaker continues, explaining it was only the second date, and the team asked him if there was a third date, and the guy said yes but he needed to talk to his roommate about boundaries. The other speaker adds "yeah, that's probably a little uncomfortable." The first speaker agrees it went viral enough that she's probably wondering a lot of things. The other speaker replies that he doesn't want that to happen again. The first speaker talks about the texts she probably received from her friends about whether she really likes him and wants to go on a third date, adding that "the stakes have been raised." The first speaker declares that "the snakes have been raised." The other speaker states that he hates snakes. The first speaker references "Jake Snakes." This transitions into speech with the first speaker telling the Diamondbacks "Good job," and then ending with what?

The clip begins with one male speaker asking a question. Someone agrees in the background. The male speaker then takes a big gulp of water, making noticeable swallowing sounds. He mentions that someone on YouTube told him not to drink into the microphone. Someone then says thanks for subscribing, followed by someone else commenting "one less watcher." A voice describes a story as awesome. Finally, music is heard.

The clip begins with two male speakers, one excitedly introducing a story about a Kid Rock concert. The first man asks, "Do you say this story's awesome?", to which the second responds in agreement, "Awesome story". The first speaker then recounts the story of a man with a colostomy bag at the concert, explaining what it is and how the man used it as a weapon to create space, swinging it around. The second speaker responds in an upbeat tone, saying that the man "just discovered this with his poop bag." They both continue their discussion, which turns into a joking commentary, as the second speaker claims the man's friends must have egged him on and brought the issue up. The first speaker expresses certainty that "one too many shots" led to the incident. The second speaker concludes the clip with a sympathetic remark, siding with the man who was "partying at Kid Rock's bar."

The clip begins with speech indicating anticipation of an action, followed by a loud, comical explosion sound effect. A male speaker expresses excitement, and then another confirms that the sound effect accurately represents the preceding action. A jingle begins with male voices announcing "employee of the week" and related content in an upbeat tone. The jingle is interrupted by speech. A speaker comments that the choice of the employee of the week "was a tough one." This speaker indicates that "no one stood out."

The clip starts with two male speakers discussing drinking from "community water", possibly a shared resource. One speaker talks about "company bonding" involving "30 straws" and their completion, while the other mentions someone having to stay until it is finished. There's talk about a guy who sold "the outfit," referencing a deal made with raw footage. One voice says, "Dude, that guy upsold the fuck out of you." The conversation then shifts to the rudeness of pointing to a mannequin.

The clip begins with a male speaker talking about initially wanting to buy "the cheapest shirt" but then getting sold on a "hot boy outfit". He mentions he was against getting the shirt as well, describing the outfit as "a piece of artwork." Then the speaker thanks someone, presumably the salesman. This speaker mentions that the salesman is "not an employee," but that they "paid him" which implies that the salesman made money. A different male voice cheers. Then there is applause. The first male speaker makes a joking remark about wanting to punch the man in the face. A musical tune in a pop style with piano and a drum beat begins. Then the audio ends.
